alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal York, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Interior York, Kennebec, Sagadahoc and Southern Oxford. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Cheshire, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham, Merrimack, Northern Carroll, Southern Carroll, Southern Grafton, Strafford, Sullivan and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Torrential downpours will impact travel with poor visibility and road ponding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A cold front slowly dropping southeast through New England this afternoon and evening is forecast to focus convection over a good portion of our forecast area around and south of the mountains. A combination of high rainfall rates, back building flow, and training thunderstorms may lead to flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough
